nqaShoJB6PFbVE4M5Hh6yg.text: Was in the neighborhood and craving for indian food. Looked up yelp and this restaurant had a good review.  I'm happy to say that it did not disappoint. I had lal mas (braised lamb in chili) with garlic naan. The lamb was tender, the sauce is spicy and full of flavor, the garlic naan perfectly cooked in the tandoor oven with crisp edges. Service is warm, friendly, and accommodating. Highly recommend.

q3Ku8ZGC5MvpyGz5eX6gEg.text: Tucked away locale that puts the India in Indian food. The dishes were tasty and were priced well for the London area. Although there was no Korma on the menu, I would gladly return to try more of UK's infamously stellar cuisine.We did sit next to a couple that appeared to be on a first date which is always amusing. They commented on liking the food as well.Kahdi ghost (spicy but not hot)Karai chicken (wonderfully peppered)Kingfisher (typical Indian lager)Naan (plain just as it should be)Souffle (the waiter was confused when we ordered this as he asked if we were sure we wanted to try this "Indian" dessert. It was disappointing but again it was more Westernized if anything. A for effort!)

QxsstxKjjf2u-sGx0hVzBw.text: Small, glass fronted restaurant on tucked away side street at the back of Borough Market area. Quite cosy inside.Nice menu with some standard Indian restaurant dishes and some variations.Our order came quite quickly and service was good. Chicken dish with coconut was a nice variation on the norm and my partner's lamb jalfrezi met the standard. Side dishes: dahl a bit dry and a touch bland. Naan bread was OK.

arbkwoXGufajgKXZxED1Tw.text: Got a delivery.  Small amount of food.  But it was all great. Chicken jalfrezi can with red sauce medium spice small amount of veg.  Normally less sauce and more veg but still it was excellent.  Rice popadom and naan all good as well.

DfPmNHxmDqje-_Feo9btgg.text: Terrific food, friendly and pleasant staff, what's not to love. My partner and I came here for dinner after a play at the Old Vic and lucky for us they had a single table left (clearly popular). We ordered samosas and the chilli squid for starter and the chicken chettinad and a spicy lamb curry (can't remember the name), naan, and the black lentil dahl. Everything delicious and I think reasonably priced. With a beer and wine each the whole thing came to £65.

Eir16t8bi2Ismsy-08P-Dw.text: great food at a moderate (for London) price. crowded, so make a reservation. In an interesting area, so if you do have to wait, there are plenty of places to have a drink. Food is varied, though more limited menu than many local Indian restaurants these days.

cSMMz9uB-56Qr7c5Ms2dYg.text: Never really been a big fan of Indian food. But I'm a big fan of this place. Absolutely a must try highly recommend. Service is excellent food is even better. If you haven't been here your missing out.

5hjHr9gItT5P5PC3saRiCw.text: Great late dinner with friends. Great portion sizes and exquisite taste of curry dishes. Must go in London

Dr8gGZo8Fzcv52Fkc9HxEA.text: Came here based on the Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint! The service was great, the staff very friendly and the food absolutely delicious. Really like the decor as well - contemporary, very comfortable, and welcoming.

6YqxGc0OmJgcdZq7472XCQ.text: A wonderful find.Let me preface this review by pointing out that on this trip to London, we tasted two things we didn't think were possible: truly bad pizza, and truly bad Indian food. On our last night in the city, we wanted to drive the latter from our minds. Encouraged by the first review, we came to the Mango Tree. It was terrific, in every way: friendly, stylish, and with a flair for making every bite complex and wondrous. We returned to our lodgings with bellies full, smiles broad, and a happy place where the memories of another establishment's atrocious curry ceased to be.Please, go and enjoy.

pzgHbOYgy7YnK43iiPdNCw.text: The Mango tree sits tucked away on Redcross way, only a couple of minutes walk away from Vinopolis, Borough Market and the Thames. The restaurant only opened about a year ago, but I've been visiting many times since then. Compared to some of the other Indian restaurant locally, the Mango tree has a more attractive, and modern interior, with leather seats. The glass front to the restaurant lets in plenty of light during the daytime. Relaxing modern music with an Indian influence plays in the background (similar to Talvin Singh, although the waiter claimed it wasn't). The staff are really nice and welcoming, and every time we go back they treat us like old friends, although I have no idea if they actually recognise me or not! The menu is pretty big and includes many of the standard dishes you find in most Indian restaurants, but have a look at the specials section for the real treats. My only criticism is that on my last couple of visits I've ordered lamb dishes and found the lamb to be too tough. Other dishes on offer have been much better. The flavour of the sauces are excellent. Prices are about average for this area, with main course curries costing around £7, specials £10. Small chocolates and a hot towel are provided on paying the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom

JBDniM7eL-pCFuhObXaRcA.text: A wonderful atmosphere in a great location (around the corner from Borough Market) with outstanding service. This place does a brisk business and we had to wait an hour to get seated. I would definitely recommend making reservations. The wait was well worth it. The staff were very attentive and earnest in ensuring that we had everything we needed.The food was great - from the Papadum (large cracker dish with dipping sauces) to the King Prawn Mango Massala. You can't go wrong with Tikka Massala (an Indian dish at its best in London). And, the Sagg Paneer was simply the best I've had anywhere. It wasn't oily and the cheese was obviously made fresh.I highly recommend this if you're anywhere near the Borough Market or Southwark area.

oTNFtyiPkRDa9oNwP53jPw.text: Ended up at mango tree due to the ignorance and stupidness of the staff at simply indian just across the street. Boy were we happy we stumped upon mango tree. The GARLIC chilli chicken tandoor is amazing! The biriyani was really good, but would prefer more rice than meat itself. Kadhi kadhi Kadhi gosh!!! Amazing!!! Give it a try if you love lamb! One of the best indian restaurants in central London!

8catZsiGRfrGx63a8hgn3g.text: Best Indian food we've ever had. Great service. A five minute walk to the Globe Theatre.

kKwq9tYJ_gCAW9HzgICvkg.text: This place has recently taken over as my Indian delivery restaurant of choice.  It's reliable rather than spectacular with the exception of their chicken shashlick which is phenomenal, so good in fact that it reminds me of the Lahore Kebab House.

z0kdV7kihre5JnP8xdbW0g.text: Best Indian I have ever eaten in London! and I've eaten alot of Indian food! You have to try this place!

CQ37e6Zq0ZUOVZP9q9K-xA.text: Visited a couple of times now over a few months and I've always had a pleasant dining experience. Tasty Indian cuisine with a well thought out menu, with nicely presented dishes and clean, fresh ingredients.Staff are decent, albeit not outstanding but are attentive enough to handle any requests promptly.Good value at just under £10 for mains. Beer and wine on offer. Also I like the ambiance of this place, it's relaxing to unwind after a long day with good comfort food.Will be sure to visit again.

X9lEg8U0xln2pWHKV9s6DQ.text: I think this place is great, it's one of the nicest Indian restaurants I've been to in a long time, it's tucked away down a side street but it's always nicely busy giving a pleasant atmosphere. The food is always spot on, they have a great selection of interesting dishes, as well as the usual favourites. I've been here on at least 5 different occasions with different groups of friends, and we've always been happy with the great food and the the friendly and efficient service. Be warned though, if you tell them you like your curry hot, it will be hot!

RzuOCJz9SiU235x4eGXSlg.text: Very delicious food with a really nice atmosphere - definitely recommend getting a reservation as space is limited.

_r3D3F_IpaotfJgAwEc1Nw.text: Fabulous and authentic South Asian cuisine. Spicy enough, and not too spicy. Upscale feel, friendly servers, moderately priced. If we lived here, we'd definitely be going back.

Dgfw-UN6coQdDsJ2GQR_cg.text: service was ok. price point was decent but portions were minimal. they charged for water without informing us (thus be advised that tap water is an option)!

AmeDzhT_r0XJAjOJvlhdTQ.text: A nice little place with great Indian food. The team has been awesome and delivered a perfect service.

YertiJUmnAHTxrIW6vfP5A.text: Very nice food, Norwegian family of four had a late dinner, all of us was very satisfied. A bit noisy but I guess it was just happy people trying to overnoise each other.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Hola

cDcuqZbf6yjzYE-l-ZN2Nw.text: My husband and I had a late dinner here on our honeymoon. We had a wonderful meal of starters and drinks. We had a nice quiet, romantic meal. The service was great, but the food was even better. We had aloo tiki, vegetable samosa, Sholey chicken tikka, some kind of onion appetizer, and garlic nan. We loved everything. Definitely a hidden gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Sampling our appetizers!

8vrGNh1yXFMJq03GpoCJow.text: Went because of good reviews. We went early in the evening. Restaurant was empty but after hesitation gave us corner table in back. Asked us whether we will finish In an hour. Food was ok. Nothing great. Whether you ordered naan, laccha paratha or tandoori roti you got same thing in varying thickness. Overall I always discount Indian restaurants that don't know anything but naan! food is not bad but nothing to deserve more than 3 stars. When we left 2/3rd restaurant was still empty.

9BhOAq6agdTmogHjU2f-Rw.text: I was on my own and had no trouble getting seated at 845pm on a Thursday.  It was busy, but not overwhelmingly so.For starters, Popadam and various chutney were good.  I don't remember the name of the dish I got (sorry!) but it was a flavored with coconut and "generously spiced" according to the menu.  The sauce was very tasty, hot and flavorful but not overwhelmingly spicy. The chicken pieces were well cooked, but a tad tougher than I usually find in Indian food.  Peshwari naan was yummmmmmy.To be fair, I think all Indian food in the UK is amazing because the options in the US just don't compare.  Taayaab's is still my favorite for Indian in London, but Mango Tree was great and a better location for me this evening.

4bXPJbnb-2NwmKT4G8tDOw.text: Wonderful meal. Came on a Sunday night and it was packed but the manager was so nice and helped us find a table after a brief wait. (Tip: make a reservation). The chai tea was phenomenal and so was every dish we had. Top spot for Indian!

OH2NDcHx7iLKYD6-_oTpJQ.text: Food was excellent- I had the chicken with green herbs and the garlic & chili naan. Especially cool was the little tiny corner table for one. Great view of the small street. A perfect British (and European) experience.

pU1Nf4SVqtLOhCK84PtwgQ.text: Shared 3 small veggie dishes for lunch and enjoyed them tremendously: the yellow daal and chickpea / spinach were very nice. Atmosphere is really pleasant and service was good, too. Can 100% recommend it!

f6b-_QZUAr4QhGtmSxHGCA.text: Excellent indian place in London. Service was great and food was very tasty not too spicy. We came late and they greeted us with a large smile. I'd recommend it in a heartbeat!

r9sYRS17EjYuVPr5VUO10Q.text: It might be helpful to make reservations here. It was pretty busy when we got there and they told us that we only had a little over an hour to eat because the table we were sat at had already been reserved, but it was OK because they were quick and we were in a rush.  Perfect for a pre-theatre dinner before a showing at The Globe!

F0_fqzDE03cLEziz3ZomMg.text: Just outstanding!  Best meal in London.  Excellent food, excellent service, nice ambience.  It all was superb.  Four of us had dinner there and we all thought the food, drink options and service were stellar.

dQfD4zZxp7vt8DTOy4ZTMA.text: Wow, one of the best Indian restaurants I've ever been to, and yes - I've been to India. Near the Tate museum, on a quiet street.  It's nice to get away from the crowd.  The lamb shank, the chef's specialty is decadent, with meat falling off the bone.  Many thumbs up!

_bWs8rOP9tW8AZpj9j7_2Q.text: An absolutely perfect meal. I would highly recommend garlic nan bread and dip that in the yogurt sauce. Some of the best Indian food I've had.

WhXrqrVq9gfmSwWylG9mcA.text: a dressed up Indian restaurant fitting for the Borough Market neighborhood. Sleek interior with very, very comfortable seating. friendly service. southern style dishes - lots of coconut + cashew seasoned items. we had a meat curry, veg curry, some rice, nan. fresh, flavorful, delicious. only complaint is about the nan. it's a really small portion and might just be store bought. very reminiscent of what i get at the grocery store and throw in the oven... otherwise, it's a decent, more upmarket style Indian place. prices reflected.

nnCqw2cHfbVQl5mMtolMGA.text: I was craving Halal food. Unfortunately it was raining (go figure) when the front desk recommended this place to me. They have quite an extensive menu and are affordable. My choices were varied and each one was spicy and delicious.  The portions were generous and not too costly. Their delivery service was quick and I hope the next time I'm in London I can go there in person.

m8MEyQsDeSYqFh9c1yWRzg.text: Wow. Best  Indian food I I can recall. Tikka meat plate had two chicken types that were done perfectly and tasted fantastic. The lamp chops were amazing. I didn't care for the ground lamb thingies but that is ok since I was too full by then. The samosa and gelato desert was excellent.. The appetizer (like very light and crispy tortilla chips with 4 dips or sauces) was also excellent. I only have one day here and I am thinking of coming back.

QX6lv8WFoZepGthQQAmZKQ.text: Atmosphere, average at best.Service: solid, but not spectacular.Food: Earned this place a 5 star hands down. Some of the best Indian food I've had in recent memory.

99m5gQ3B5DAvKfA4VrkHVA.text: Excellent food, very nice service, a lot of guests eating here confirm the quality and great taste.

g4eQL8dAuxjiFZ8b5RcN8A.text: We had just completed two walking tours and stopped here for dinner, cold and hungry. The staff was kind and gracious and the food was absolutely delicious!!! Lots of sauces, the meat was so tender and flavorful, and the sides were perfection. So glad we found this spot!

noSznbQhTQZzS-VqcB7_Yg.text: This was the best Indian that we are in London. Tucked away in a nice alley. It was really good. The lamb was unbelievable.

fd7hidlZEy9cFwSf8qw9Mg.text: Dropped in at 5:20 which I realize is very early. The place was completely empty. I was told by a bartender, "sorry, we are totally booked.  The people will be pouring in any minute."  Hmm.

Q-t7Er903-JuKkIJ5DvxxA.text: Delicious!!!My husband and I were on our way to check out the Tate modern museum and wanted to check out some Indian fare since London is known for some great Indian curries!Found this place on yelp and it was easy to navigate to on our phone gps. The place looks a little out of place but it's cozy and has some great food!We started with some tea and then ordered the lunch special with 2 items which was a pretty good deal. We both ordered the chicken tikka masala and got the lamb and chicken starters. We also got the vegetable of the day included with our meal which was okra. Oh, we didn't forgot about naan! We ordered a side of garlic naan as well!The whole meal didn't take too long to come out and  everything was really delicious! The tikka masala had a more tomatoe-y tang that was more prominent in this dish then I was used too but it was still very delicious. The okra had great flavors to it and the starters were flavorful and cook perfectly.Would love to come back for dinner to try other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Garlic naan yum!!
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Lunch special one with lamb and the other with chicken starters. Both with chicken tikka masala and okra (veggie of the day)
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Basmati rice

Oa_zmYMFEDND6h1samm46Q.text: Awesome food. Truly good Thai with lots on spice in the spicy seafood pad Thai and green curry was on point. Friend got the vegetarian-ish fried rice with nuts and pineapples... Not something I would've ordered but even that was good! Scallop appetizer with chili and lime was amazing. Also some great drinks in decorative presentations!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Chili lime scallop appetizer

lK7_6Knc5MfIFIQluJafjQ.text: I was on business trip and was in London for a week, was staying in a nearby place. Found this place on Yelp and visited them as I was craving for  Indian food. The food is really good, very authentic Indian taste. The customer service is very good too. Overall very good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Naan, potato vegetable, chutneys and paneer dish.

yHZcR7y1xA6e1Ew00KSRVw.text: I found Mango Tree exclusively through the help of my Yelp app so I trusted my fellow Yelpers and they did not steer me wrong!We had Dishoom earlier that week but Mango Tree was a top contender as the best meal we had in London.First off King Cobra beer was the best tasting beer we had on our whole trip, so refreshing and smooth, a must-try.I ordered the chicken curry, fish curry, garlic naan, and an eggplant appetizer.Every single thing was delicious and the flavors completed each other so well, it was so robust and tasty and the spices were superb.I've had great Indian food in LA and OC but this is a place I will definitely come back to time and time again when i venture back to London. Also, the service was top notch!  Thank you Mango tree!!!!

-awj3tFJQlpC6Zcxivpzyg.text: Wonderful food, superb service.  If I was local to London, I would try to visit at least weekly!  Can't wait to go again.

Xlnt1w4UQ9JR0QvFRObv1g.text: We just finished our meal here and agreed it was among the best, if not THE best, Indian meal we've ever enjoyed. The sauces were subtle, spicy and complex.... the samosas were crispy and delicate, the Naan fluffy and flavorful. We're only sorry we are leaving London in two days and probably won't have time to visit again.

SmzxBpxOiih5iUrhfJ_KUg.text: I'll admit that I don't remember exactly what we had here. There was a lamb dish and a chicken dish which seemed to come cloaked in the same tomato-y type sauce.  Poor ordering on our part but they were both delicious. We also got a couple of veggie sides, one with aubergine and the saag aloo (at least I remembered the name of one dish!)Lovely meal away from the crowds of Borough Market. Yum!

Senhr18Z0gpaLEHGOR-lKA.text: Mango Indian was the exact type of London Indian food I was looking for! Being a tourist, all anyone tells you is to try London's Indian food and Mango did not disappoint!!!! The food, the service, the environment, all well worth 5 stars!!!!

No_iuMFiuxR9p-oJi9v6HQ.text: The food here was outstanding. Very quaint little place off of Borough Market. My wife and I had the Lamb Lahori and the Lall Mass and we spilt them. Both were outstanding.  The Lall Mass is spicy.  Ask for the papadum to start with the chutney.  Also, they have an extra topping called spicy pickles which is very good with the papad but not on the menu.  Also very spicy. Service was good, but make sure you make a reservation / booking.  It is a small place and they fill up fast.

iy79ZlWmzdkmjJOy57xsyA.text: I tried to order take out, and the person on the phone lied to me about the delivery driver not being there when he couldn't figure out what hotel I was at. Then he hung up on me when I asked if I would be able to get any food. Unbelievable.

dpcF5q3BylMO63yMVNsGUQ.text: This is a great place to eat and catch up with close friends. it is discreet, warm and friendly. The service is great and the food.. The food is wonderful... Each bite sends you back to India... Enjoy!

f-J5yo8Jy8v2ntqZlSccAQ.text: Fancy a warm, delicious curry mere moments away from the hustle and bustle of Borough Market?  Mango Tree is your place!With made-to-order lunch specials that are bargain-priced (especially compared to other restaurants near Borough), you can have a started, veg and main for under £10.  The onion bhaji was crisp, well-seasoned and served hot from the fryer.  The paneer veg mains were creamy, full of aromatic spice.  Hidden down a side alley, Mango Tree is a three minute walk from Borough, and is an excellent way to take a respite from the crowded, touristy mecca of food markets.  Warm yourself up with a nice pot of tea, you won't be disappointed with Mango Tree.  The basmati rice is fragrant, and well-portioned.  The meat dishes are equally satisfying.  If you are wary of too much spice, please alert your server you'd prefer your dish relatively mild.  Else their "standard" is slightly on the spicy side.  (I prefer it that way, but one of my lunch guests was less keen on the spice level)Delicious enough that it is worth a trip on its own, if paired with a Borough Market shopping trip, you've made yourself an excellent start to the day.

GtQTzV4g2LJUsYbApC3UyA.text: This place was great! I came here with my parents after seeing a play at the Globe. They even let us in the restaurant about 10 minutes before it technically opened because we were so hungry.I ordered the Makhani Murgh, my mom the ordered Lamb Korma, and my dad ordered the Kadai Lamb Lahori. We all shared a side of Sagg Aloo and lots of basmati rice.My parents have pretty conservative palates (particularly my dad), and all of us were thoroughly pleased with our dishes.They did make a mistake on the bill and charged us for different (and more expensive) rice than the basmati rice we ordered. But when we pointed out the mistake, they quickly removed the charge and gave us the basmati rice for free, which was nice.

V-hTlYMQwd7p43p_ZfpsAw.text: The dishes were flavorful and well presented. Some of the best Indian food I've ever had! The service was excellent. I suggest making reservations at peak times.

YGXTIUbiabSSjXfjoFTYTg.text: My wife and I visited late in the evening. We were seated within 5 minutes with no reservation. This is not a large restaurant, so we may have been a bit lucky!Being the simple Americans that we are, we ordered the classic choice of Chicken Korma and Tikka Misala, along with rice and naan.The food was ready in a normal amount of time. Not fast, not slow. The korma was sweeter than what we are used to, and the tikka misala was spicier than expected as well, but this just added to the variety and everything tasted great. We felt the price was reasonable too.Our female servers were nice, and the male manager was nice to us, but at one point he seemed angry and started arguing with one of his female staff. We couldn't tell what he was saying, but we felt bad for her, and it all really just seemed inappropriate and disrespectful.Maybe they were just having a stressful night. I hope that isn't the norm. So anyhow, 5 stars for the food, but 4 stars overall. If you like Indian food, give this place a try.

gvJGdBNkyO8ujzj_QIilzg.text: Had originally planned to go to Dishoom, but the line was CRAZY long so we ended up here and was not disappointed. It's a small restaurant on an off street with nice modern decor and very clean. The food was just excellent. I usually tend to avoid spicy foods because certain spices turns me into a water fountain, but I'd gladly drench in my own sweat again to eat here. The prices were also very reasonable and the wait staff were very nice and accommodating. I'm sure Dishoom is very good as well, but if you're like me and don't like waiting on long lines, come here.

Wy_FhuCNoTosGtydDo9eFg.text: Excellent food, friendly service. Mention yelp. ***** service if your American Try the seafood tandori platterProper quality popadpms tooCheers!

3RR-2sg8_dH4Z6RdYN3zgg.text: Very, very good Indian food. 5 stars for the food, 3 stars for the service and ambiance.We ordered the makhani murg (butter chicken), a lamb and spinach dish, naan, basmati rice, and veggie samosas. The entrees--the chicken and the lamb-- were both FANTASTIC. Delicious spices, tender meat, everything you hope for in a high quality Indian dinner. The naan was fluffy and incredibly light, and the rice was cooked perfectly. The samosas were kind of strange, they seemed to be wrapped in a phyllo dough rather than the thicker crust that I have always encountered when ordering samosas. But they tasted fine.My complaint about the service: we were put in a table in a corner that was wedged in very tightly, which made it an uncomfortable meal. I was disappointed that this happened, especially considering the restaurant was empty when we entered and remained so throughout the entire meal. Also, the server touched my silverware with his hands once when he was serving us, which grossed me out. Finally, the women's bathroom is incredibly small-- if you are taller than 5'6", I don't think you would be able to sit on the toilet at all. The wall was literally inches from my nose!My tip: Mango Indian great food, but maybe opt for takeaway. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Lamb with spinach and spices
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Yummy Indian meal!
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Butter chicken (makhani murg)

YbA1_rrZu9jTGcCqiUiYBQ.text: Food was a 9/10. Service about a 6/10. Russ when j called to make a reservation. Had to ask for water 3x. Food was great though. Lamb samosas were fantastic. And the meat platter was very good as wel

wid5xdJxMYOafwd3sGCwEQ.text: Very tasty!  Ordered the Lamb Shank along with a bottle of Pinot.  The lamb was very nicely cooked where the meat fell right off the bone and the wine accompanied it fitted nicely.

6bgablC5ZbY9PdrtB0LJYA.text: London has some really great indian food and Mango Tree Indian restaurant is one of them. Located next to the famous marketplace, Mango Tree restaurant was better than any indian food I've had in the states.  It's not about the intensity of the flavor but also how balanced you make them...which Mango tree got spot on.  We came here during lunch and they had a nice prixe fixe lunch menu.  I don't quite remember how much each prixe fixe combo costed, but I remember it being really decent and easy on the wallet for the amount/quality of food you receive.  Chicken kabob: Solid appetizer.  Seek kabob: While the flavor was good, it was a bit on the dry side.Okra vegetable mix: This was absolutely fantastic.  Could have eaten this as a main dish by itself because it was so flavorful.  Chicken Tikka Masala : Very different than what I usually have in the states.  This one was much more flavorful and had less of an emphasis on cream.  I can tell they used a lot of ingredients in here because the sauce was quite chunky, akin to a puree of flavor.  Lamb : Not sure which one I ordered but it was really delicious and cooked exceptionally.  The lamb had very little gamey flavor to it.  Basmati rice:  Usually I don't rave about rice but this was great.  The rice was seasoned well and was extremely fragrant.  Who knew rice alone could have so much essence.  Garlic nhan: This didn't come with the set meal but is a must order.  Crispy and full of garlicy goodness.5 stars.  I'm extremely happy I found this place on yelp so don't miss this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Tika masala

HrM-StYHCB8wgTtMqa1mew.text: I was craving Indian food so we made reservations for Friday night.  Highly recommended to make reservations during busy weekend evenings.  Unfortunately, the Tube line went out of service just before my friend could catch a ride.  She ended up cancelling for the evening.  Determined to not let the night be a disappointment, I decided to give it a try solo.  Thank goodness I made this decision.   I found this hidden gem down an off-side street. Inviting modern front decor convinced me to satisfy my craving.   As I previewed the outside menu, a gentleman exited with a carry out order.  So, being inquisitive, I asked if the food here was good.  With a wide grin, he praised it with complete abandonment.  I was convinced to give it a try.

MVNGMaX1fEwZLja7DnvVSA.text: An amazing meal in London!  A wonderful combination of flavor and presentation. Our group of Boston Mass foodies thought this was one of the best Indian meals we've had on either continent. Yelp did not let us down!  Delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Sport I ate it!

r4wQ11sCuvqnj8W-Wx9p3w.text: Amazing Indian food. Great service. We ordered the Goan Fish Curry (?) and palak lamb. Some of the best I've ever had. Brings friends and order to share! Also, he the papadam basket with sauces to try to start. We left super full.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom

K7poyftw25PZa04zZ5y4UQ.text: Terrific back-up option to the always fun Borough Market.  We arrived too late for the Borough and were pleasantly surprised to find this gem tucked away down a narrow street. We didn't have any reservations but they found a tight spot for us. We just beat the busiest time but found the service was attentive and we didn't feel rushed.  We didn't get too adventurous on the menu but the chicken tikka masala and a curry (sorry I can't remember the specific item) exceeded our expectations. We were pleasantly surprised by the papadum, not something we normally order, and the great range of flavors in their dipping sauces.  So, if you're looking for a spot off the beaten path but close to the Market, give this place a shot.

52tJZRNfC0Zn8Aa0M_KdRQ.text: Had lunch at Mango Tree last week...here are my thoughts:Ambiance: This restaurant is small and in a very hidden location. But it's nicely decorated and clean.Service: All of the servers were quite nice. Apparently the kitchen closes at 2:15 or so, and we arrived at about 2, so we felt kind of rushed when the server notified us we had just a few minutes to place any orders.Food: Quite good for the most part.-- Scallops were not mind-blowing (like Zaika's) but they were good.-- Aloo Tikki was too fried for me and the accompanying chickpeas were quite spicy. I don't recommend this dish.-- Rice was good.-- Daal was well received (didn't get to try it).-- Chicken was also well received (didn't get to try it).-- Roti was nice and fresh.-- Pear + sorbet dessert is refreshing and delicious. I highly recommend.Overall I would recommend Mango Tree, especially if you are in the Borough Market / London Bridge area. Not sure I'd seek it out again since it's not really convenient to our place though.

G7ggCON7cxwJ6qQ-OWABHQ.text: Best Indian food we've ever had! My family and I constantly eat Indian so we have a lot of restaurants to compare it to and this is by far all of our favorites- we've never eaten Indian food this good. We came to London for just a few days and ate here our first night. After that, we tried other Indian restaurants around the area so that we wouldn't eat at the same place each night but we should have just eaten a different kind of cuisine because no other Indian restaurant came close. Great bang for your buck, highly recommend!

_4grwSbCwyysfCFatrpaaw.text: Most overpriced curry meal I've ever had. If you are going there and expecting a diverse range of authentic curry then it is best to go elsewhere. If for business, then it's an easy location to get to

QhbdrviQTf0bvFtLlwi5Pw.text: Due to circumstances I found myself alone and wanting for some great Indian food. By chance, while walking around the neighborhood I found this great little restaurant. It's not too big, has great atmosphere, excellent service and to top it off also great food!I decided to go for an all prawn meal. While I cannot remember the names of the dishes, I had the king prawns as starter and the prawn curry with saffron rice as main. All the flavors were very well balanced. The amount exactly right. Luckily, since I came alone, I could quickly be seated. Outside there were quite a few people waiting. I recommend making reservations, especially at busy nights!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Dessert pear with mango sorbet
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Main: prawns
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Starter: prawns

20uKhMB_O5_kxD3rnyqT9Q.text: Quaint restaurant tucked away just off the main road. Clean, modern interior with fun music. The staff enjoys what they are doing and it shows in the service and the quality of the food. The menu was different from some of the Indian restaurants we have tried in the past, but that encouraged us to try some new dishes and we were not disappointed. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom

pE3kL77XfM2H9pfGxyrUUA.text: Best food we had in London on my honeymoon.  We tried high end restaurants and this is by far my favorite.  I got the lamb shank shikadari with mushroom rice and the portion of lamb was great and so tender.  The spices ran through the meat  My husband got the chicken chettinad and was great too with rice and naan.  I wish we had this restaurant back in Los Angeles!! I also recommend the kebab and platter soo good

BzNRNHuNjVHTUVuTqXEQWg.text: Really fantastic tasting food. Glad I went out of my way to visit this place. I was originally going to try Dishoom, but when I got there the night before the line was out the door and the wait was over an hour. F that! After still craving good indian food, I booked it over to Mango based on it's high rating was really happy with I did. The place is a bit small, but the food made up for it/ I'd get my dish over day after day for a year if I could. Loved the experience!

awsjmqfz2W1-sbtxouqR4Q.text: Staff treated us very badly. We called an hour before and booked a table, upon arriving the staff told that they have allowed us to eat at their restaurant but we must vacate in 1-1.5hr (even though the restaurant was 90% empty). This is extremely demeaning when you called in advance, reserved a table and then giving us ultimatum upon arriving at your restaurant. Why did not you told us in the phone?? We were about to leave their restaurant so then manager said ok 1.5 hour we can give you, please get seated. We were tourists in London visiting from US and were very very tired as we walked all day in St. Paul cathedral, Tower of London, crossed tower bridge and then walked to this restaurant, so we said ok. Then we were never asked for water and after half hour upon asking, we got some water without any ice. We ordered food initially, after 15 mins we asked to add a small appetizer and the server called the manager who rudely said no he cannot do it as we already ordered! We saw that same appetizer was served to other table 10mins after our order was denied. We felt extreme bad, and wanted to leave but we already ordered and we are not as low as these restaurant people are on their behavior and commitment. So we stayed back. Basically these people are racist and are horrible of a staff! Don't go here at all! They are a big rip off! They sold 4 samosas of mini sizes to us for 12 pounds.. they added gratuity in the order under sales charge, and poor us not knowing their trick, we paid extra gratuity in cash as well, thinking they accommodated us, however we should have not, as 90% of the restaurant was still empty. Food was not great either. Moreover when we asked for some lemons with the food, they added 5pounds for some salad even without telling us at the time we asked. These people are really bad and a big rip off!

gsqh3ZWvkohBw6u2N-AkvQ.text: Fantastic Indian Food in London! Wait staff accommodating though not too attentive. Highly recommended, just south of the Thames in the Southwalk area...

2NB5DqvckGSSIufNsTyKiw.text: I ordered LALL MASS £10.50Rajastani hot preparation of lamb, red crush chilli and ground aromatic spicesIt was so yummy. Tender lamb in spicy, beautiful, smooth red sauce,with buttered naan and perfectly flavored rice on the side. Wow!

1aB3mB-IWNjshxEn5LV13Q.text: Such a lovely meal. Stopped there after the play for a light meal. Had the chicken tikka, mahkani and the kebab platter. The naan bread was very tasty. Hope to come back some day from the States.

Xwvj09hkG4pdY7seg5arQw.text: Walked in at 6:30 and thought the place was a little deserted. That made me a little worried and I nearly walked out. Glad I did not.Wonderful fusion restaurant located right by London Bridge. I loved the concept and decor. Very rich with wooden paneling and lovely plush furniture.The food is amazing. First of I would suggest ordering the papad, especially if your going to order alcohol. The papad paired perfectly. I then ordered the Paneer Anchaari and it was simply wonderful. It was probably the best tandoori I have had in a while.  The service was quite good and the prices seemed very reasonable.A superb Indian fusion restaurant in the heart of London.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Paneer
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Papad

TLCb4b3htQwrKhd0kPRo-w.text: Came here for dinner on my last night in London. Had the following:* Starter of Papadum with Chutney - delicious. I only received two Chutney's. Photos on yelp show 3 chutneys and another vegetable side though. Not sure if maybe the other 2 sides only come with ordering the extra papadum. Appetizers:*Aloo Papri Chatt - delicious. Reminds me of the Vik's chaat in Berkeley, but here they add some berries that really compliments the dish. *Onion Bhajia - delicious. They could've given more of the chutney / dipping sauce. Main:* Chicken Chettinad - delicious. You could really taste the star anise. * Dum Biryani with Chicken - delicious as well. Dessert:* Gulab Janum with Vanilla Gelato - delicious. Loved the vanilla gelato. Although, I looked online and it looks like its vanilla ice cream. Overall the service was great. They were very kind and attentive. This place is amazing. This and Vik's Chaat in Berkeley are probably my top Indian places and they serve very different things. I would highly recommend this place to friends. I actually enjoyed this place a lot more than Dishoom. This was probably my best meal in London. Furthermore, the prices were really reasonable!TL/DR: This place is amazing. I enjoyed it more than I did Dishoom. I would highly recommend it. And the best part, the prices are really reasonable.

joBaduetY5hUgmfy62CdKQ.text: Delicious food!  We can here two nights in a row because my twin 10-year olds begged us to have the Murgh Makhani or butter chicken again.  It was perfect in sweetness, richness, spice.  The first night we also had the chicken tikka which we were able to add to the butter chicken sauce.  We also had the lamb chops which were really flavorful.  The second night, we also had the chicken tikka again with the butter chicken and also tried the salmon tikka.  It was my favorite dish of them all.  Perfectly cooked - not dry at all in the inside, but very crispy on the outside and great flavor.  Will definitely come back next time I'm in London.The staff was not he most friendly.  While they were perfectly nice, nothing was done with a smile.  But they did accommodate us without a reservation two nights in a row.  The place gets busy later in the evening.

Eg2JwS05xdmGt3sQMs8y0w.text: Close to Tate Morden museum. Very different taste Indian food. Every dish is perfect, extremely hot lamb and lamb shank for adults, karma lamb chops for kids, they love it. Vegetable curry is too spicy for kids, but for us, great!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom

AQYrodkD6aOSVQydcGyf_w.text: If you're American don't even bother to come here. They will deny you service and claim to have no tables available even when there's a ton of empty tables. When we walked in and asked for a table for two the first guy who greeted us pretended not to understand us then another guy came up and said we need a reservation because all of the tables are for reservations who for some reason are all happening at the same time. So random. I was like okay I get it you guys don't like Americans. I guess they don't need our business with all of the damn empty tables.

f6ya6UFK9CPPFTeVxcw5Hw.text: Not a fan at all. The makhani curry was too sweet and I had to take it back. I think they literally put cane sugar in it. I switched it out with a non chicken curry dish and it was a lot better but not great. And why are the napkins at this place over starched? Not a fan.

bdMJpi-4bK7OoU3Ml37jNA.text: Empty restaurant, just one patron . I am a single person there.One look at me and he says he can't seat me without a reservation .Yes, I understand restaurants need reservations , and I know how they work. But when you are freaking empty at 3 PM in the afternoon, you are just being an ass and I'm calling you such, or better post a notice on the door

uaZKxbVyhcoJwAIr4ACcrw.text: Food was nice and tasty. Chicken Chettinad was really good. Problem with locating the restaurant and we didn't had reservation and although lot of table were open still they didn't allow to dine in and minimum wait time was 1hr. End up taking food as to go. 15min wait for to go was not bad at all.

63tztZJRbZtL9-RGq8P4qg.text: This was a hard one. So many highs and so many bleh's but for the price, the blehs won out. Services: bleh. They were sorta nice? Not rude. Not friendly. Very quiet and a bit empty. The lamb chops for appetizer were amazing. I had super high hopes after eating the lamb chops. But the curry dishes just lacked the adventure and the complexity you love about Indian food. Everything went downhill after the lamb chops. I had high hopes since I looked at reviews and we hopped an Uber out here. Totally not worth it. There's an Indian place that's walking distance from where I live that I'd rather go to than make the trek out here. So basically, if you don't live by, don't bother.

TGz0b4Sn_XJTtHSGV6uqqg.text: Best Indian we've ever had in London, and even in NYC! Lovely staff. Would definitely go back here next time we're in London again.

cxcXg5qt0--Q7BBiA0YXsw.text: Where do I begin? My husband was craving for Indian food while visiting London for the first time. We had such disappointment from another Indian restaurant of horrendous customer service that I wasn't too sure about stepping foot into another Indian restaurant. However, Mango Indian had a lot of great reviews on Yelp, so we decided to take a leap of faith. Thank God we did! I'm not crazy about Indian food to begin with, but Mango Indian took my breath away and made me look at Indian food in a whole new light. Mango Indian gives off a more upscale vibe and food can be a little pricier compared to other Indian restaurants we've ever been to. However, Mango Indian in Borough Market didn't disappoint. Here is what we ordered:Chicken Tikka Masala- Very good, a little on the sweeter side, but still creamy and the chicken was moist.Goan Fish- Taken away by this curry fish. I didn't know what I was going to be getting when I ordered this, but this was the best Indian dish I've ever had. It was so flavorful and tasty and every bite was sacred. Also comes with a lemon saffron kind of rice, which went great with the food!Garlic Naan- Smaller portions, but crispy and made to perfection.Vegetable Samosas- Looks can be deceiving. This starter dish came out and it looked smaller, but was extremely delicious and crispy with the lemon mint sauce that came with it. Comes with 2 samosas.All in all, Mango Indian in the UK was amazing, from service to food. We will be back for sure if we are ever back in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Chicken tikka masala and goan fish (curry fish)
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Vegetable samosas

2sEfc6yErtAn0sRtiqmjgQ.text: Food: We had lamb, hariyali chicken tikka, bread sampler, dahi baingon, chilli paneer and rice. You get two sizes large and small. We picked small (they were really small, like two servings). Had a Cobra beer and still waterPlain Naan was light and fluffy, garlic Naan was okay. Baingon( eggplant) was mild and creamy and paneer was meh. Lamb was good though the saalan( gravy) was spicy. Folks sitting in a table behind us had the same reaction, so beware if you don't like spicy lamb.Hariyali chicken tikka was juicy, mild and well marinated. Definitely the winner.Price: I am not sure if this is a British thing, but who charges for water!!!! C'mon folks. 4£ for a bottle of still water. That sucked.Service: Prompt, friendly, not stuffy.Total for 3: 76£ (ouch!)Would we go again: Probably but I would be smarter about the dishes we pick.

3WWyHocK9vVJbd4cUkWMag.text: This was a wonderful find in London. We found the atmosphere welcoming, the service impeccable, the food was amazing! My wife had even traveled to India and was impressed with the quality and authenticity of the food. The cider was also among the best we've had. You must save room for deserts as they're worth the extra calories.

AIHjKnViAb7PjLdIlG7ryA.text: I was told London was the place to find the best Indian food outside of India. We came to this place and it did not disappoint. Food was fantastic and so was the service! Would come back!

fmYIlfYM_JnI3mrM3VO36Q.text: I came for a very late lunch, because I'm on Pacific time and was easily seated.  The food was delicious and the price was reasonable.

7UGHMRGlHVJNqHRHWqLgIw.text: Mango Indian was phenomenal. We went back twice within one week and tried different dishes each time--loved them all.  Can't wait to go back again!  The food was exceptionally flavorful with just the right amount of heat.  The service was great and the atmosphere authentic. I highly recommend it.

PekG-4gY_m-KUMyF56aWtQ.text: This place is simply amazing, after our first day realizing that when in London reservations are a must I took up my friends suggestion on mush having Indian food when in London. The food service on ambiance was top notch. Appetizers we opted for the seafood plater which was fresh scallops that were so tender. The Somosa with lamb the flavors and the dough was just perfect. Main dishes we decided to split chicken jalfrazi which was spiced perfectly with capsicum and other spices, which went well with the nann bread. But the star of the night was the goan fish curry with lemon rice. The coconut flavors in the sauce just made your mouth sing. Let's just say I will be back this gem is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom

1UrX3VR2dWTSZDS3uGq6YQ.text: Flavorless Indian Doesn't live up to the expectations. Chai tea with faint flavor of spices. Tandoori fish wasn't fresh maybe even previously frozen and quite remote from what you'd expect from tandoori. Ambient isn't Indian. Oily papadam and gooey overly sweet chutneys. Overly rated restaurant. Nice staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom

UcwgnbCaOwUuaTwxMbWiCw.text: Service is lacking. Wasn't treated like a guest but rather an inconvenience (we arrived at a normal time and not 5 minutes before closing either). Food is fantastic. Ambiance is dark and nice but you are practically sitting with to the other customers next to you. A great place for people listening, if that's your thing, no judgement.

dMTyOMZgICrWrz4NakYvig.text: If it wasn't for the extremely loud conversations going on in this tiny restaurant I'd give it another star.  But, for food wise it was delicious and perfectly sized.  Not too much so that a couple of dishes could be tried.  Found this place while walking between Borough Market and my hotel in Southwarck.  Nice little gem and open until late (11pm).

photos.caption: Photo of Mango Indian - London, United Kingdom. Garlic Naan and Chicken Tikka.  Can't remember the name of the curry dish but it had fish and was great.
